author: Clint Morgan
title: Bequeath:  Inheritance tracking
description: Assignment, tracking, claiming, distribution of personal property after death

assessments.note: Very well defined problem and solution with real potential for success. The proposer bring great experience to project and the potential to affect almost everyone in the community brings value not only in safety for the user but potential real life solutions to important proceedings on assets and identity valuables.

With aging population in most of the so-called developed nations, this is a very timely topic. However, the challenge is to make it grandma-easy. How can an 80-year-old use this to save an "unlock" their last will when the time comes.
The proposal presents a technology advancement to a very old process and clear application of blockchain to "real" world issues.
This proposal provides no technical documentation to unpack the idea in detail or development roadmap.

The idea is very amazing and would make lot more sense as we progress with more digital assets and transfer of assets. The idea is very well-defined making the requirement of tokens very clear.

Effectiveness of the solution considering the feasibility, skills needed, technology stack required on Cardano platform requires much more research and collaboration.

Integration with real world legal system would be a challenge though it can be used for pure digital and crypto assets at this point in time
Nowhere in this proposal is a link to a technical document describing how this dApp functions in depth. the project plan is talking about the tokens minted but not the core workflow of the dApp.

As an idea this proposal has tremendous merit. The proposer seems to have laid out a well-thought of effective solution which covers all aspects of and the complexities and the actors involved in the execution of a last will & testament. The proposal also lays out the establishment of such a will-as-an-NFT and the processes whenever amendments are required. The proposer seems to have a good grasp of crypto technologies and protocols. There is a benefit not just to Cardano's ecosystem but to the global community, provided cryptographically embedded wills are recognised legally. Chinese courts accept blockchain data as proof/evidence given the immutability of blockchains
This is a wonderful service to provide to the community and will help widen Cardano's ecosystem.

This is the type of project that can bring large numbers of people to Cardano. Exactly our objective, There are several proposals that attempt to deal with inheritance in a secretive way, None that simply place a will on the blockchain and execute via smart contract. The proposer recognises thee are many things to discover about this solution, but has covered as many bases as possible at this stage. Excellent approach

The challenge was clearly defined, and I believe you demonstrated both the technical and business subject matter expertise to address the challenge.

To complete your proposal, it would be useful to know the metrics related to this challenge. You described in detail how Bequeath would work and the supporting framework around it through multiple tokens, but to me it just seemed like as an as-is replacement for the current living will system, so I don't think you answered the "So what?" question. In other words, what advantages would Bequeath offer over current living will systems? For example, given the inherent tamper-proof characteristic of blockchain systems, it would be interesting to know how Bequeath would prevent fraud, and whether current will fraud rates are high enough to justify the value proposition of Bequeath.

Added with few developers that can support this project, the proposer brings the bulk of the experience required in the solution defined. There is clear roadmap and even execution strategies on how it can be achieved.
As said in the comments, it would be good if you could partner with other similar projects / proposers.

The idea is very well detailed, but implementation of it is not. There seems to be significant technical challenges in order to successfully implement this proposal, that would require a experienced team of developers. The experience of the proposer is clear, but it seems unfeasible for him to tackle the project alone and in part-time
There is no detailed project roadmap or budget breakdown. it will take more detail and effort to receive support

The experience in the software field is great. Also skills and experience on Cardano platform or collaboration with existing developers with like minded ideas would help which is not demonstrated in the proposal.

Joining discord group of or Project Catalyst can be helpful for initial collaboration and discussion.
Nothing about the project roadmap or timeline are made clear in this proposal. Highly unlikely this will be implemented successfully in the next 6 months.

Despite the confidence assigned to the Impact of this solution, the proposal lacks the plan on how the development will be approached in terms of timelines, resources required, budget allocations & metrics. And as it mentions, this proposal is only part of a multi-pronged development and impacts of 'other' associated token developments of which this is but a part.
Very clear detailed plan. I believe that the proposer will be able to implement it successfully.

Everything about this proposal suggest common sense approach that is doable. His 20 years s full stack dev is perfect for the task - neither underestimating the effort nor overestimating his ability.. Plan outline for several tokens seems very sensible.

You clearly have a strong vision for the realization of this project, but you seem to be caught in a Catch-22 situation where you're only willing to invest the time and resources needed to ensure the success of the project if you receive the Project Catalyst funds. This is understandable to me and I'm not expecting you to have a team of developers lined up, but I got the impression that you have sufficient project management skills to estimate approximately how many developers you would need and over what period of time. I think you should also be able to estimate how the $40,000 will be spent in terms of the project phases. Adding high level budget and project plans would increase my comfort level that this project will be successful.

Technology interface appears to be questionable as wristbands can be taken from someone and safety in storing and accessing the data appears a bit of void in the objective but the purpose of solving the problem and the ideas defined a start of a project that can grow to resolve some of the question I raised earlier can be explored in its potential growth as a Dapp.
You said: "If there is a genuine interest in these projects I will put together a formal estimate". Please do. There will be more interest then.

The proposal provides enough detail on how to address the challenge, but is missing a roadmap or milestones. There is also no budget breakdown or the presentation of success criteria i.e. what would be a good outcome
This proposal describes a dApp concept the proposer has minted some tokens for. There is no Github linked, technical documentation or roadmap/metrics included in this proposal at all.

More clear plan with timelines and details
 * Collaboration with developers on the platform
 * More details on technology for key elements to be deployed
 * Readiness of the required support on the current system
 * Feasibility of external legal system to accept the controls from digital system. Currently legal system is not ready to accept legal documents using smart contracts. Integration with legal system would be a challenge.

The idea seems to be well-defined and also there seems to be a intent and readiness to research more thus expecting the proposal to come back more stronger in time to come.
This proposal is lacking all of the basic documentation required to effectively address the challenge.

The proposal is well-thought of in terms of the challenge and the potential solution. It presents how such a problem can be resolved with a dapp elaborating well on the intricacies of real-world scenarios involved in the process of inheritance transfers. However, the lack of a solid plan and the restrictions on the time of the proposer himself as admitted, and the lack of a team who will develop and deploy the solution does not provide great confidence that it is feasible at this stage. An itemisation of the plan and milestone and resourcing and budgeting is required including the presentation of associated token proposals to get a big picture of how much this entire solution will cost. Presenting the associated proposals at the same time should also tease out any dependancies that impacts the overall success of this solution.
It's a nice and complete proposal.  It would be better for the proposer to break down the cost in detail for auditing.

The proposal is well considered and detailed in its scope. It identifies talents needed and core talents that are already available. Impact is as broad as any project could be.  Everyone should have a will. And nowadays onward that will should be on blockchain.

You provided sufficient details to address the technical feasibility of the project.  However, this is a very ambitious proposal in which you're not just building a DApp but, if understood correctly, you're standing up an entire framework for living will management with various DApps and tokens, so I think the risks for this proposal will be magnified several times compared to a regular DApp proposal. We need to know the anticipated risks and how you plan to mitigate them. For example, instead of creating all 5 tokens as part of this initiative, would it be possible to partner with other initiatives or existing projects/services? For identity verification, wouldn't it make more sense to use Atala PRISM instead of building your own custom solution? It seems to me that the Bequeath framework would require a high level of interoperability and integration, and this needs to be addressed a little more in your proposal.

solution: Living wills have been around for centuries. We need to move them to a blockchain with NFTs & added benefits of real-time data availability.
experience: I have 20 years of full-stack (MS) development experience. I'm also an Entrepreneur that would love to leave something useful behind.
